definition[0]: computer machinery and equipment, as opposed to the programs that make computers work
definition[1]: equipment and tools for your home and garden
definition[2]: the machinery and equipment that is needed to do something
definition[3]: computer equipment, rather than the programs that make it work
example[1]: Unix runs on most types of computer hardware.
example[2]: An upgrade (=improvement) in our  hardware helped us cope with an expected rise in demand.
definition[4]: equipment and tools for homes and gardens
example[3]: If the housing market is strong, hardware and electrical products benefit.
definition[5]: the machinery and equipment needed to do something
example[4]: the shipment of US tanks and other military hardware to Saudi Arabia
